documents.t: Overview AlphaBuilder is a modular quantitative research and trading framework that unifies signal generation, risk modeling, derivative pricing, and portfolio optimization. It is designed for adaptive, regime-aware financial systems, capable of integrating classical econometrics, deep learning,reinforcement learning, and quantum-inspired optimization within a single research pipeline. Modules AlphaBuilder-Signal — Extracts predictive features from time series and cross-sectional data using Deep Time Series Forecasting (DTSF), Hidden/Markov Models, and Transformer-based architectures for regime detection and market sentiment. AlphaBuilder-Risk — Implements dynamic risk estimation under regime shifts, combining econometric volatility forecasting, Hidden Markov Models (HMM), and Bayesian methods to quantify uncertainty across asset classes. AlphaBuilder-Vega — Focuses on derivative pricing under stochastic and regime-modulated volatility, connecting directly to your dissertation:“Pricing with Markov-Modulated Stochastic Volatility.” AlphaBuilder-Optimizer — Provides classical (Markowitz, Black-Litterman), heuristic (Genetic, PSO, Simulated Annealing), and quantum optimization (QUBO-based and QAOA) backends for portfolio allocation and model calibration. System Architecture The system follows a modular two-tier architecture: AlphaBuilder-Hub — Hosts and manages pre-trained models onHugging Face, serving as the model registry for signals, volatility surfaces, and forecasting modules. AlphaBuilder-System — The orchestrator layer that connectsSignal → Risk → Vega → Optimizer into a continuous pipeline for backtesting, live trading, and research. Each component communicates via standardized APIs, ensuring interoperability across different computational paradigms — classical, stochastic, heuristic, and quantum. Goals & Philosophy AlphaBuilder embodies the principle of adaptive decision intelligence — the ability to learn, forecast, and optimize financial systems dynamically across regimes. It is both a research platform and a practical execution engine, designed to bridge the gap between academic models and live financial applications. The long-term objective is to enable fully autonomous, explainable, and regime-aware portfolio management systems that can adapt to structural market transitions, similar to how macroeconomic states evolve under hidden Markov dynamics.

Beta Neutral Funding Arbitrage Trading Funding Arbs with Only Perps A practical approach to earning risk-free yield by capturing funding rate discrepancies in perpetual markets. Read on Substack → Volatility Regime Shifts How Markov Models Capture Market Transitions Understanding volatility clustering and regime transitions through Markov-modulated models in derivative pricing. Read on Substack → Portfolio Entropy & Risk Information Theory in Modern Portfolio Design Exploring entropy as a measure of portfolio uncertainty and diversification within modern optimization frameworks. Read on Substack → Funding Rate Dynamics Mechanics Behind Perpetual Swaps A deep dive into the mechanics of funding rate formation and its role in market equilibrium for perpetual futures. Contact AlphaBuilder We’re always open to collaborations, research discussions, and feedback on our projects. Join our communities or reach out directly at alphabuilder.research@gmail.com— we’d love to hear from you. Email LinkedIn Discord Substack Twitter

Signal AlphaBuilder-Signal is the predictive intelligence layer of the framework. It extracts, engineers, and evaluates multi-regime alpha signals from time-series, cross-sectional, and event-driven data. The module integrates both econometric and deep learning paradigms to generate robust, interpretable, and regime-aware features for downstream risk and optimization engines. Signal Types # Signal Type Description / Notes 1 Price / Return Features Raw prices, log returns, percentage returns, high/low/close differences 2 Moving Averages SMA, EMA, WMA, Hull MA across multiple horizons 3 Technical Indicators RSI, MACD, Bollinger Bands, ATR, ADX, Stochastic Oscillator 4 Fundamental Indicators P/E, P/B, dividend yield, earnings surprises (if available) 5 Formulaic Alphas Top 101 classic alphas (momentum, volume-based, reversals) 6 Regime-Aware Signals HMM / SMM / SSM states, probabilities, and conditional features 7 Volatility / GARCH Signals Predicted conditional variance or volatility from GARCH family models 8 Statistical / Arbitrage Signals Z-score, cointegration, mean-reversion, pair-trading indicators 9 Network-Aware Signals Correlation-based signals, eigenvector centrality, cross-asset influence 10 Entropy-Based Signals Entropy metrics capturing uncertainty or structural complexity 11 Fractal-Based Signals Hurst exponent, multifractal spectrum, long-memory indicators 12 Event / Sentiment Signals News or social sentiment, event-driven features, earnings flags 13 Multi-Resolution Signals Wavelet decomposition, scale-specific trend/volatility features 14 Regime-Weighted Features Combined volatility, entropy, and regime-weighted signals 15 Derived / Meta Signals Feature-engineered combinations (e.g., volatility-adjusted momentum)

Regime-Switching Derivative Pricing Measure-Theoretic & Markov-Modulated Volatility A mathematical treatment of regime-switching models in derivative pricing using measure theory, stochastic calculus, and hidden Markov models. View Paper → Portfolio Optimization under Regime Shifts Reinforcement, Heuristic, and Quantum Methods Exploring hybrid optimization methods under market regime uncertainty using metaheuristics and quantum-inspired solvers. View Paper → Entropy, Information & Portfolio Risk Information-Theoretic Approaches to Diversification Applying entropy and information geometry to measure uncertainty and optimize risk diversification in multi-asset portfolios. View Paper → Markov-Modulated Volatility in Risk Forecasting Applications to AlphaBuilder-Risk Engine Integrating regime-switching stochastic volatility models into real-time risk estimation pipelines within the AlphaBuilder System. AlphaBuilder-Optimizer AlphaBuilder-Optimizer is an experimental Python package for building and testing optimization tools in trading and portfolio management. It provides a clean API interface and serves as a foundation for research, development, and integration into modular trading systems. Current Status The project is in its early stages. The current version includes: A FastAPI backend for portfolio optimization. An equal-weighted strategy as the initial supported method. A framework for extending to more optimization approaches. Planned Features Portfolio Optimization Classical methods: Markowitz, Black-Litterman, convex optimization. Metaheuristics Genetic algorithms, simulated annealing, swarm intelligence. Reinforcement Learning Adaptive and regime-aware optimization approaches.

AlphaBuilder-Signal AlphaBuilder-Signal is an experimental Python package providing a curated library of trading signals for quantitative finance. ⚠️ This package is currently in early development. More features, indicators, and signal types will be added soon. Features Technical Indicators: RSI, MACD, ADX, %D, Bollinger Bands, Momentum, etc. Lagged Features: Previous price, returns, and indicator values for time-series modeling. Moving Averages: SMA, EMA, HMA, and other variants. Target Indicators: Returns, peaks, troughs (regression and classification targets). Data Fetching: Asset wrapper for seamless download from yfinance. Coming Soon Additional technical and fundamental indicators Handcrafted alpha factors and custom rule-based signals ML-based signals (tree models, RNNs, transformers) Regime-aware signals using HMMs Backtesting utilities (Sharpe ratio, hit ratio, performance metrics) Statistical arbitrage signals (Copula, Vine Copula, Correlation) News-based signals
